0.title: Time to end Russia's "absurd war" in Ukraine: UN Secretary-General
0.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres on Tuesday said it's time to end the "absurd war" started by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Continuing war in Ukraine is morally unacceptable, politically indefensible and militarily nonsensical," he added. UN chief also urged to stop hostilities and called for serious negotiations. Meanwhile, at least 925 civilians were killed in Ukraine till March 20.

1.title: Will dig up & raze your houses if you hit poor: MP CM to criminals
1.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said on Tuesday that he will "dig up and raze" the houses of criminals if they raise their hand on poor people. Chouhan added that he won't let criminals live in peace. His comments come days after a clash broke out between two communities in the state's Raisen district, which lead to one death.

2.title: Delhi NCR developers plan to halt construction as raw material costs soar
2.article_body: Developers in Delhi NCR are planning to stop purchase of raw materials and construction activity due to rising raw material costs, according to industry body CREDAI NCR. "After COVID-19, the current crisis is a dual blow on real estate developers," said CREDAI NCR President Pankaj Bajaj. CREDAI members in Maharashtra are also planning to stop work for the same reason.

3.title: Dalit woman raped by 8, including 2 DMK members, for 7 months in TN
3.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Police has arrested eight persons, including four minors and two DMK members, for allegedly raping a 22-year-old Dalit woman for nearly seven months in Virudhunagar. The main accused, Hariharan Mahendran, filmed his intimate moments with the victim and later showed it to his friends. The accused threatened to leak the videos and raped her repeatedly.

4.title: Video shows Farooq lashing out at media when asked about Kashmiri Pandits
4.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM and National Conference veteran Farooq Abdullah was seen in a video lashing out at reporters in Parliament premises on Tuesday when asked about the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits in the 1990s. "You (BJP) want to know the truth, you should appoint a commission," he said. When asked another question, he replied, "Don't push me."

5.title: BSE seeks clarification from Paytm's parent company over fall in share price
5.article_body: The BSE has sought a clarification from Paytm's parent company One 97 Communications Ltd over a fall in its share price. It said the clarification is sought to ensure that investors "have latest relevant information about the company and to inform the market". While the issue price of Paytm shares was ₹2,150, the price dropped to ₹543.90 in Tuesday's trade.

6.title: Rishi ji called me insecure actor on 'Sharmaji Namkeen' sets: Juhi
6.article_body: Actress Juhi Chawla has revealed that late veteran actor Rishi Kapoor screamed at her on 'Sharmaji Namkeen' sets because she kept checking the monitor. "Chintu ji was like, 'Monitor is not meant for actors. Why are you behaving like an insecure actor?'" the actress said. Juhi added that she would crack up but still go and see the monitor.

7.title: Playing for ₹10 lakh or ₹10.75 cr in IPL doesn't matter: RCB's Harshal
7.article_body: RCB pacer Harshal Patel said he's going to play in IPL 2022 "exactly" the same way like he played last year and price tag of ₹10 lakh or ₹10.75 crore doesn't matter. "No new skills, all I...hope...is (that) I'm more precise in my execution," he added. Harshal was bought back by RCB for ₹10.75 crore in IPL mega auction 2022.

8.title: Authentication firm Okta probes report of digital breach
8.article_body: Okta is investigating report of a digital breach on its platform after hackers posted screenshots of what they said was the company's internal information. Okta had detected an attempt to compromise the account of a third party customer support engineer in January and believes this breach to be related, it said. The hackers belonged to ransom-seeking group known as LAPSUS$.

9.title: WhatsApp rolls out message reactions for Android Beta users
9.article_body: WhatsApp is releasing the 'Message Reactions' feature for some users on WhatsApp Beta for Android. Only certain beta testers have received the ability to test the feature which includes six emoji reactions. With another recently announced multi-device update for WhatsApp Web and WhatsApp Desktop, users can access the app on four devices without having the smartphone connected to the internet.

10.title: 21 flights cancelled at Bagdogra Airport due to damage on runway
10.article_body: Flight operations were halted as 21 flights were cancelled at Bagdogra International Airport in West Bengal's Siliguri after the damage was reported on the runway on Tuesday evening, Bagdogra Airport Director P Subramani said. He, however, said the morning operation "was okay as seven flights landed in the morning and five took off". Subramani added flights will operate normally tomorrow.

11.title: Sri Lankan Parliament approves amendments to anti-terrorism law
11.article_body: Sri Lankan Parliament on Tuesday approved amendments to the country's contentious anti-terrorism law. The amendments to the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) will include the reduction in the detention period of the accused and expedited hearing of cases. The law allows authorities to make warrantless searches and arrests if a person is suspected of being involved in terrorist activity.

12.title: UN General Assembly Special Session on Ukraine to resume on Wed
12.article_body: The Emergency Special Session of the UN General Assembly on Ukraine will resume on Wednesday, UNGA President Abdulla Shahid tweeted. The announcement was made after 22 member states, including France and the US, wrote a letter calling for the resumption of the session. A draft resolution sponsored by Ukraine and other member states is being processed, a UN official said.

13.title: I've played for so long, know what to talk: Raina on commentary debut in IPL
13.article_body: Speaking about his commentary debut in upcoming IPL, Suresh Raina said he'll enjoy it and feels it'll be exciting. "I've played for so long, so I know what to talk [about] and where...doing commentary is something I still need to learn. It'll be difficult," he added. Raina went unsold in IPL mega auction in February after being released by CSK.

14.title: Marilyn Monroe painting expected to fetch $200 million at auction
14.article_body: Auction house Christie's on Monday said a portrait of actress Marilyn Monroe by Andy Warhol called "Shot Sage Blue Marilyn" is expected to fetch an estimated record $200 million at auction. Christie's Chairman of 20th and 21st Century Art Alex Rotter said the work "is poised to be the most expensive painting of the 20th century ever sold at auction."

15.title: DMK worker & 4 minors, among 8 held for raping 22-yr-old woman in TN
15.article_body: The Virudhanagar Police on Monday arrested eight persons, including a DMK worker and four minors for allegedly raping a 22-year-old woman and threatening to release the video on social media. DMK leader Kanimozhi Karunanidhi said that it's "consoling" that the accused have been arrested. "Strong action has to be taken against the accused, no matter who they are," she added.

16.title: Pak, China sign 5 agreements to strengthen 'iron-clad friendship'
16.article_body: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi and his Pakistani counterpart Shah Mahmood Qureshi signed five bilateral cooperation agreements during a meeting in Pakistan's capital Islamabad on Monday. "Ways to further strengthen the iron-clad friendship between the two countries were discussed," the Pakistani Foreign Office said. Separately, the two ministers also discussed the conflict in Ukraine, it added.

17.title: Video captures moment when a tornado approaches Walmart store in US' Texas
17.article_body: A video has surfaced online that captured the moment when a tornado approached a Walmart store's parking lot in Texas, US on Monday. In the video, people can be seen running to take cover amid high-speed winds. A storm system that passed through Texas, Louisiana, Mississippi and Alabama has reportedly left at least one person dead and 19 others hospitalised.

18.title: SRK's daughter Suhana, friend hide face inside car as media click pics
18.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana was seen hiding her face along with a friend inside their car while leaving Mannat as media persons clicked pictures on Tuesday. One of the pictures shows her talking to the driver while her friend kept his face hidden with his hand. Suhana will reportedly debut in Zoya Akhtar’s film based on 'Archies' comics.

19.title: Illegally built house of main accused of Shahdol gang-rape destroyed
19.article_body: The illegally built house of the main accused of the gang-rape of a 28-year-old woman in Madhya Pradesh's Shahdol district was destroyed on Tuesday, following the order of the district administration. According to the police, the woman was raped by three men on Saturday, who later fed her a poisonous substance, which led to her death in a hospital.

20.title: Centre seeks report from West Bengal govt after houses set on fire killing 8
20.article_body: After at least eight people were killed as houses were set on fire in West Bengal's Birbhum, the Centre sought a detailed report on the incident from the state government. Violence was reported from Boktui village after TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh was killed. CM Mamata Banerjee has asked the DGP to take immediate action against perpetrators of the violence.

21.title: Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai buys helicopter costing ₹100 crore
21.article_body: Dubai-based Indian billionaire Ravi Pillai, the Chairman of industrial development conglomerate RP Group, has bought an Airbus H145 helicopter costing ₹100 crore. The helicopter was delivered by Airbus in Kovalam and took its inaugural flight from Kovalam to The Raviz Ashtamudi. The helicopter is capable of landing and takeoff from even high altitudes of 20,000 feet above sea level.

22.title: BSP's votes shifted to BJP: SP leader on UP Assembly poll results
22.article_body: Reacting to the results of UP Assembly elections, Samajwadi Party (SP) leader Imran Masood alleged that the BJP benefitted from the Bahujan Samaj Party (BSP). "It is a 100% fact that the BSP's votes transferred to the BJP," he said. Masood, who resigned from Congress to join SP before the polls, added that elections should be conducted using ballot papers.

23.title: India's cumulative COVID-19 vaccination coverage crosses 181.56 crore
23.article_body: The cumulative number of COVID-19 vaccine doses administered in the country crossed 181.56 crore on Tuesday, the Union Health Ministry said. Meanwhile, over 34 lakh children have so far been administered the vaccine against COVID-19, the ministry stated. Notably, India reported 1,581 new COVID-19 cases and 33 deaths in the last 24 hours. India's daily positivity rate stands at 0.28%.

24.title: Mere breach of contract is not in itself a criminal offence: SC
24.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday said that a mere breach of contract is not in itself a criminal offence and gives rise to the civil liability of damages. A bench comprising Justices S A Nazeer and Krishna Murari said the distinction between mere breach of contract and cheating, which is a criminal offence, is a fine one.

25.title: Will never impose sanctions against Russia: Serbian minister
25.article_body: Serbian Interior Minister Aleksandar Vulin on Tuesday said government will never impose sanctions against Russia for its invasion of Ukraine. "Serbia will never be part of the anti-Russian hysteria in which property of Russian citizens and property of Russian Federation is stolen..." added Vulin. Serbia is the only European nation that has refused to join international sanctions against Russia.

26.title: Lucknow Super Giants unveil their first jersey and theme song, share video
26.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG), who will make their debut in IPL 2022, have unveiled their first jersey and theme song. The KL Rahul-led franchise will don a cyan-coloured jersey. Their theme song 'Ab apni baari hai' has been sung by Badshah, while its video has been directed and choreographed by Remo Dsouza.

27.title: Sonia holds talks with Congress' rebel leaders at her residence
27.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi on Tuesday held discussions with some rebel party leaders, also known as G-23, at her residence in Delhi. The party leaders included Anand Sharma and Manish Tewari. Gandhi is likely to meet some other leaders of the group in the coming days. The G-23 leaders have been demanding an organisational overhaul.

28.title: Passed trial by fire, will continue to oppose CAA: Ishrat after bail
28.article_body: Former Congress councillor Ishrat Jahan, who was granted bail on March 14 in a Northeast Delhi riots case, said it was her "trial by fire" and that she will continue to oppose the CAA. The court, while granting her bail, stated that she wasn't physically present in Northeast Delhi during the riots, nor was she part of any organisation.

29.title: Non-stop calls overwhelming, I am even late for work: 19-year-old Pradeep
29.article_body: Pradeep Mehra, the 19-year-old McDonald's worker who went viral for running 10 kilometres every night from his Noida workplace to Barola to join the Army, said, "Who doesn't like attention? But you enjoy it more when you have spare time." He added, "However, I am busy running errands, so non-stop calls are overwhelming. I am even late for work!"

30.title: Might put Bappi Lahiri's gold collection in a museum: Bappa Lahiri
30.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri said they are going to preserve the late singer's gold collection. "Those [Gold] were not just fashion statements for dad, it was lucky for him...We want people to see his things...we might put them in a museum," he stated. Bappa added the late singer collected each of those gold pieces from around the world.

31.title: I'll try my best to keep him relaxed: Rashid on compatriot Noor at GT
31.article_body: Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan, who along with compatriot Noor Ahmad Lakanwal will be representing GT in IPL 2022, said he'll share his IPL experience with 17-year-old as it's a big stage, requiring mental strength. "I'll try my best to keep him relaxed," he added. Rashid further said that IPL is a "big opportunity" for fellow countryman Rahmanullah Gurbaz to learn.

32.title: 2 MP tribal welfare dept employees held for taking ₹80,000 bribe
32.article_body: Two employees of MP's Tribal Welfare Department were arrested on Tuesday for taking a bribe of ₹80,000. An official said the two accused were nabbed when they were accepting the amount from a hostel superintendent for releasing the scholarship amount of ST students in Shivpuri. They were identified as RS Parihar, Shivpuri District Coordinator (tribal welfare), and clerk Awdhesh Sharma.

33.title: 11 arrested after 8 killed as houses set on fire in WB's Birbhum
33.article_body: Eleven people have been arrested after eight persons, including two children, died in West Bengal's Birbhum district as nearly 10-12 houses were set ablaze. The incident happened hours after deputy gram pradhan of the Trinamool Congress was killed in a bomb attack on Monday night. "We are investigating...whether the incident is related to death of Trinamool panchayat leader," police said.

34.title: Nadal's Indian Wells semi-final was like an exam for him: Uncle Toni
34.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal's semi-final win against Carlos Alcaraz in Indian Wells, world number three's uncle Toni Nadal said the three hour-12 minute match was undoubtedly complicated for his nephew as if it were "an exam". Alcaraz hit 39 winners to Nadal's 20. The 21-time Grand Slam champion wasted 15 break-point opportunities before defeating the 18-year-old 6-4, 4-6, 6-3.

35.title: Floods kill 5 in Brazil a month after storms killed over 200
35.article_body: Authorities on Monday said heavy floods caused by torrential rain have killed at least five people in Brazil's Petropolis following a similar disaster that killed 233 people last month. Another four people have been declared missing since Sunday. Emergency officials said a month's worth of rain fell within a few hours on Sunday, damaging around 100 homes and causing landslides.

36.title: 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli' relies heavily on the performance: Rasika
36.article_body: Actress Rasika Dugal has said that her upcoming film 'Lord Curzon Ki Haveli' relies heavily on the performance. "That kind of challenge is a delight for an actor," she added. "There is so much meat for my character in the film that I sometimes felt I had traversed multiple genres within the same film," she further said.

37.title: 10 million people now homeless due to Russia’s invasion of Ukraine
37.article_body: The International Organization for Migration (IOM) on Monday said nearly 6.5 million people have been internally displaced in Ukraine, on top of the 3.3 million that have escaped the country so far. The IOM's Director General Antonio Vitorino said the scale of human suffering and forced displacement of people due to the invasion "far exceeds any worst-case scenario planning."

38.title: Police register FIR against 4 for selling plots against norms in MP
38.article_body: Police have registered an FIR against four people for selling plots while allegedly violating town planning norms in Madhya Pradesh. An official said on Tuesday that the four accused as well as many others have also been reportedly prohibited from selling any plots further. The FIR had been ordered to be registered by Jabalpur DM Dr Ilayaraja T.

39.title: Cost of EVs to be at par with petrol-run vehicles in 2 years: Gadkari
39.article_body: Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari said cost of electric vehicles (EVs) will be at par with cost of petrol-run vehicles in two years. Emphasising on the need to shift to a cost-effective indigenous fuel, Gadkari said rapid strides in technology and green fuel will reduce EV costs. Cost of driving EVs will be about 1/10th of petrol vehicles, he added.

40.title: I'm not joining 'Lock Upp', I've done 'Bigg Boss': Rashami Desai
40.article_body: Actress Rashami Desai has stated that she is not going to be a contestant on Kangana Ranaut's reality television show 'Lock Upp'. "I've done a similar format show with 'Bigg Boss 15'...But a full-time association to the show is not what I'm currently looking at," she said. Rashami added that she would make a guest appearance if she is invited.

41.title: Payal couldn't be good leader, thus our team suffered: Babita Phogat
41.article_body: Following her eviction from the reality show 'Lock Upp', wrestler Babita Phogat has said that Saisha Shinde and Kaaranvir Bohra are the strongest contestants in the show. Speaking about actress Payal Rohatgi, who was her team's captain in the show, Babita said, "Payal could not be a good leader and thus our team suffered a bit."

42.title: Kashmir files can be reopened if there's a specific need: J&K DGP
42.article_body: On being asked if Kashmir files and cases related to the exodus of Kashmiri Pandits from the Valley can be reopened, J&K DGP Dilbag Singh said, "The files can be reopened if there's a specific need." "We have been pursuing and will keep pursuing any case related to terrorism. We will not spare anyone who is responsible." he added.

43.title: Things people didn't know came to public domain: J&K LG on Kashmir Files
43.article_body: Lieutenant Governor of Jammu and Kashmir Manoj Sinha on Tuesday reacted to the Anupam Kher-starrer 'The Kashmir Files' film and said "If someone makes a film, they have a perspective." Sinha said, "I think it is good that several things, which people did not know, have come to the public domain and people now have fresh knowledge of the same."

44.title: Don't make unwarranted statements: Mamata on Guv's 'arson orgy' remark
44.article_body: After Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar described the violence in West Bengal's Birbhum as 'arson orgy', CM Mamata Banerjee wrote to him asking him to refrain from making unwarranted statements. Banerjee said Dhankar's statements were unbecoming of a person holding a constitutional post and asked him to allow the administration to conduct an impartial probe. Eight people died in the violence.

45.title: Violence, arson orgy in Birbhum, WB in grip of lawlessness: Governor
45.article_body: Responding to the violence in Birbhum district, in which eight people died, West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar said that the violence and "arson orgy" shows that the state is in a "grip of lawlessness". The violence erupted following the alleged murder of Bhadu Sheikh, the Deputy Chief of the Barshal gram panchayat, which is controlled by the Trinamool Congress.

46.title: People walking up to me for selfies, I feel shy: 19-yr-old Pradeep
46.article_body: After a clip of his midnight run in Noida went viral on social media, 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra said his world has changed overnight. "People are walking up to me and asking for selfies! I feel shy," he said. Mehra added, "It happened suddenly. Not in my dreams I expected my video to go viral and people chasing me for pictures."

47.title: 63 Indian cities are among 100 most polluted places on Earth: Report
47.article_body: As many as 63 out of the 100 most polluted cities in the world are Indian, as per the World air quality report 2021. Of these, more than half are in Haryana and Uttar Pradesh, while some are in Rajasthan, West Bengal, Punjab, MP and Bihar, the report said. Cities from neighbours Pakistan, China, Bangladesh also feature in the list.

48.title: Norwegian King Harald V tests positive for COVID-19: Royal palace
48.article_body: The royal palace of Norway on Tuesday said Norwegian King Harald V has tested positive for COVID-19. "The king has light symptoms and will be on sick leave in coming days," the palace added. The 85-year-old monarch has remained the ceremonial head of state since 1991 after he ascended the throne upon the death of his father, King Olav V.

49.title: 31-yr-old actor dating a woman online finds out he was talking to his father in US
49.article_body: Hollywood actor and filmmaker James Morosini revealed that he was catfished by his father posing as a woman on Facebook. The 31-year-old said he started dating a woman named Becca based on similar hobbies and interests. "I discovered it was my dad. He basically created this whole profile as a way of making sure that I was okay," Morosini said.

50.title: At least 1,100 earthquakes hit Portugal’s Azores islands in less than 48 hours
50.article_body: At least 1,100 small earthquakes were recorded in less than 48 hours in one of Portugal's mid-Atlantic volcanic islands. While the authorities urged residents to stay calm, an official at Azores archipelago's seismo-volcanic surveillance centre said the earthquakes have not caused any damage so far. The magnitude of the quakes ranged from 1.9 to 3.3 that struck Sao Jorge island.

51.title: 22-year-old Shanaya Kapoor buys Audi Q7 worth ₹80 lakh
51.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor and Maheep Kapoor's 22-year-old daughter Shanaya Kapoor has bought an Audi Q7 worth ₹80 lakh. Audi Mumbai West's Instagram handle shared a series of pictures of Shanaya posing with the car along with her parents. Earlier this month, filmmaker Karan Johar had announced her Bollywood debut with Dharma Productions' upcoming film 'Bedhadak'.

52.title: Uganda should end torture of detained citizens: Human Rights Watch
52.article_body: Human Rights Watch (HRW) on Tuesday said Ugandan government should end torture of citizens detained at detention centres. In its 62-page extensive report, HRW said the detainees, mainly government critics and opposition supporters were beaten, raped, electrocuted or injected with unknown substances. Report documented forced disappearances, arbitrary arrests and unlawful detention from 2018-2021.

53.title: Kapri shares cartoon criticising media after requesting them not to bother Pradeep
53.article_body: Filmmaker Vinod Kapri took to Twitter to share a cartoon criticising the media after requesting media persons not to bother 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra for interviews. Mehra, who works at McDonald's in Noida, went viral after Kapri shared a video of him running 10 kms after work to prepare for the Army. "Just let that kid live his life," Kapri tweeted.

54.title: Would appreciate if Pope mediates with Russia: Ukraine's Zelenskyy
54.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said on Tuesday that he had spoken to Pope Francis and added that he'd appreciate Pope mediating with Russia on the conflict. "Told His Holiness about the difficult humanitarian situation and the blocking of rescue corridors by Russian troops," Zelenskyy had tweeted. Notably, Pope Francis has condemned Russian invasion several times and appealed for peace.

55.title: EU set to delay sustainable farming plans amid Russia-Ukraine war
55.article_body: European Commission (EC) is set to delay the publication of proposals on sustainable farming amid the war between Russia and Ukraine. This comes as EC was due to have put forth two proposals on binding targets to restore nature and a new pesticides' law on Wednesday, March 23. Notably, agriculture contributes to roughly 10% of EU's greenhouse gas emissions.

56.title: China aims to boost renewable power, natural gas output by 2025
56.article_body: China's National Development and Reform Commission on Tuesday said government aims to increase renewable power and natural gas production by 2025. As per commission, China will maintain annual crude oil output at 200 million tonnes and ramp up natural gas output to over 230 billion cubic metres. Beijing would also encourage developing ethanol, biodiesel and bio-jet fuel, the commission added.

57.title: 5 lakh refugees from Ukraine have mental health issues: WHO
57.article_body: About 5 lakh refugees from Ukraine in Poland need support for mental health disorders, Paloma Cuchi, WHO representative in Poland, said on Tuesday. Around 30,000 refugees suffer from severe mental health problems, she added. Refugees arriving in Poland are suffering from a range of health problems, including Diarrhoea and dehydration, Cuchi further said.

58.title: Hackers loot over $600,000 from 29 Li.Finance crypto wallets
58.article_body: Hackers looted crypto assets worth over $600,000 (₹4.57 crore) from 29 wallets associated with Li.Finance, the crypto swap aggregator said on Sunday. Hackers violated the swapping feature of its smart contract and drained crypto assets from wallets that had given infinite approvals, it added. Attackers looted crypto assets like Polygon and USD Coin and converted them into 208 Ether tokens.

59.title: Dubai airport to shut one of its two runways for 45 days for overhaul
59.article_body: Dubai International Airport on Tuesday said it will close one of its two runways for extensive refurbishment work for 45 days starting May 9. The airport added that the northern runway will be shut to upgrade the airfield to ensure safe and efficient operations. The operator added some services will be moved to Al Maktoum International during the closure.

60.title: Lebanon's central bank chief charged with graft amid economic crisis
60.article_body: Lebanon's central bank chief Riad Salameh has been charged with corruption, a judge said on Monday. Salameh, whose wealth is reportedly being investigated by authorities in five European countries, was accused of illicit enrichment and money laundering amid Lebanon's economic crisis. Lebanon plunged into financial crisis in 2019, leading its currency to lose over 90% of its value since then.

61.title: Mayor of Ukraine's Boryspil urges civilians to leave city amid war
61.article_body: Volodymyr Borysenko, mayor of Ukraine's Boryspil on Tuesday advised civilians to leave the city amid war between Ukraine and Russia. "I call on the civilian population to reach out to our call centre and leave town as soon as an opportunity arises," Borysenko said. Meanwhile, at least 925 civilians were killed in Ukraine from February 24 to March 20.

62.title: Russian newspaper reports 10,000 soldiers killed, later says site hacked
62.article_body: A Russian newspaper briefly reported on its website that nearly 10,000 soldiers were killed since its invasion started in Ukraine before it removed the numbers. The newspaper later accused hackers of planting the death toll on its website. The article, while quoting a Russian defence ministry official, said that 9,861 Russian servicemen have been killed and 16,153 wounded so far.

63.title: Maha CM's brother-in-law raided by ED, properties worth ₹6 cr frozen
63.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Tuesday provisionally attached immovable properties, worth over ₹6 crore, allegedly linked to Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's brother-in-law Shridhar Madhav Patankar. The properties include 11 residential flats. ED is probing a money laundering case against Pushpak Bullion and found that illegal funds were allegedly diverted to Patankar's company.

64.title: People can see pain of trans women for a simple he and she: Saisha
64.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Saisha Shinde has questioned her fellow contestants about not asking for her preferred pronouns. She further asked actor Kaaranvir Bohra how he would feel if he was called 'she' or 'her' on a regular basis. "At least they can see that a trans woman will go through so much pain just for...simple...he and she," Saisha said.

65.title: Padma awardees visit National War Memorial in Delhi, pics surface
65.article_body: The Padma awardees, including paralympic javelin thrower Devendra Jhajharia and writer Sachchidanand Swami, who were honoured on Monday visited the National War Memorial in Delhi. Pictures show the awardees paying tributes to the Armed Forces personnel. President Ram Nath Kovind on Monday presented the Padma awards at a ceremony held at the Rashtrapati Bhavan.

66.title: Govt's PLI scheme not leading us towards closed economy: NITI Aayog VC
66.article_body: Centre's Production Linked Incentive (PLI) scheme for Aatmanirbhar India is not leading us towards a closed economy, NITI Aayog Vice Chairman Rajiv Kumar said. He added that India remains deeply committed to greater integration with global flows and the regional network. Inviting investments from Japan, he said, "Japanese companies are very well placed to [help us] achieve [these goals]."

67.title: Russian Nobel winner to auction medal to raise funds for Ukrainian refugees
67.article_body: A co-winner of last year's Nobel Peace Prize has said he would donate his Nobel medal to be auctioned to raise funds for Ukrainian refugees amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Nobel laureate Dmitry Muratov announced the decision in an article published in Novaya Gazeta newspaper, where he's Editor-in-chief. Over 3.5 million people have fled Ukraine since the invasion began.

68.title: How does the 2022 Women's World Cup points table read after India's third win?
68.article_body: Following their win against Bangladesh, India are now third on the 2022 Women's World Cup points table with six points from six matches. Australia are on top of the table with six wins out of six, while South Africa are second with eight points from four matches. Pakistan are last on the table having won one out of five matches.

69.title: NASA shares 'sounds of discovery' of 5,005 planets outside our solar system
69.article_body: NASA on Tuesday shared a 360-degree animation and sonification tracking humanity's discovery of the planets beyond our solar system over time. This came after the number of known exoplanets passed 5,000 on March 21, 2022. The clip shared by NASA showed the data converted into sounds, allowing users to hear the pace of discovery.

70.title: 'Rocketry...' isn't commercial venture, but national duty: Madhavan
70.article_body: Actor R Madhavan, speaking about his upcoming film 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect', said the film isn't a commercial venture for them but a national duty. The film is based on former ISRO scientist Nambi Narayanan, who was wrongly accused in 1994 of leaking defence secrets. "Had there been some other country, Nambi would be called a national asset," Madhavan added.

71.title: Clean-up of one of Delhi's largest lakes initiated by DJB
71.article_body: Delhi Jal Board (DJB) has initiated the clean-up and rejuvenation of Bhalswa Lake, one of the largest water bodies in Delhi. The project's first phase includes revamping of the drainage network and cleaning legacy waste accumulated in its 30 metre periphery. DJB will also lay down an interceptor drain to act as a second layer of protection from future contaminants.

72.title: Child can't be tried as adult even for heinous crimes: Bombay HC
72.article_body: Even if a child has committed a heinous crime, he/she can't be automatically tried as an adult, the Bombay High Court said recently. The court rejected the ATS wing of Aurangabad's plea against the order passed by a special court. The ATS wanted to try a child in conflict with law (CCL) as an adult in an alleged terrorism case.

73.title: Burger King UK accuses McDonald's of copying its food item; shares meme
73.article_body: Burger King UK has accused McDonald's of copying one of its food items as the latter recently shared new additions to its menu. Burger King accused McDonald's of copying its Chilli Cheese Bites and shared a meme on Facebook, which read, "Can I copy your homework?" Burger King claims it has been serving the item for the last 15 years.

74.title: Hyd Police shares road safety post with clip of high-speed bike crash
74.article_body: Hyderabad Police has shared a series of road safety posts online with CCTV clips of accidents happening across the city. In one of the posts, it wrote, "Don't let your speed...[make] innocents [suffer]," while sharing a video wherein an elderly man was hit by a high-speed bike. In another post, it advised people to look before opening their car's door.

75.title: Vikramaditya Singh, grandson of J&K's Maharaja Hari Singh, quits Cong
75.article_body: Former J&K MLC Vikramaditya Singh, the grandson of J&K's Maharaja Hari Singh and son of Congress veteran leader Karan Singh, resigned from Congress on Tuesday. In his resignation letter to interim party chief Sonia Gandhi, he wrote, "It's my belief that the Congress is unable to realise and reflect the sentiments and aspirations of the people of Jammu and Kashmir."

76.title: Nigerian gang cheats 700 girls looking for NRI grooms, arrested
76.article_body: Gwalior's crime branch on Tuesday arrested a Nigerian gang allegedly involved in cheating girls looking for Non-Resident Indians (NRI) as prospective grooms. The Gang had allegedly cheated around 700 girls across the country. The accused were arrested from Delhi and Additional Superintendent of Police (crime), Rajesh Dandotiya, said that the action was taken following a woman's complaint.

77.title: Will ensure there'll be only one toll plaza within 60 kms: Gadkari
77.article_body: Road Transport and Highways Minister Nitin Gadkari on Tuesday said he'll ensure that there will be only one toll plaza within 60 kilometres. If there's a second toll plaza, then it'll be shut in the next three months, Gadkari added. Last year in March, Gadkari had said that all physical toll booths in India will be removed within a year.

78.title: Water supply to Pune's Aga Khan Palace cut over non-payment of ₹1.70-cr dues
78.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has disconnected the water supply to Aga Khan Palace due to non-payment of dues worth over ₹1.70 crore, an official said. As per the Archaeological Survey of India's conservation assistant, 700 to 800 visitors come to the palace on weekdays and around 1,200 on weekends. He said PMC has been requested to give a new water connection.

79.title: Assets worth ₹19,000 cr belonging to Mallya, Nirav Modi & Choksi seized: Govt
79.article_body: The Centre has informed the Parliament that it has so far seized assets worth ₹19,111 crore, belonging to fugitives Vijay Mallya, Nirav Modi and Mehul Choksi. It further said that the three of them have defrauded public sector banks to the tune of ₹22,585.83 crore. It added that assets worth ₹15,113.91 crore have been restored to the public sector banks.

80.title: I think Red Bull is the favourite: Ferrari boss Binotto on F1 season
80.article_body: Ferrari Team Principal Mattia Binotto believes Red Bull are the favourites to win this season, despite Ferrari finishing first and second in the season-opening race in Bahrain. "I think Red Bull is the favourite, with Max [Verstappen] being the world champion," Binotto said. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc and teammate Carlos Sainz finished first and second respectively at the Bahrain Grand Prix.

81.title: Very pleased: Yastika on her 50 vs Bangladesh in Women's WC
81.article_body: Following her 'Player of the Match' award after being top-scorer in India's 110-run win against Bangladesh in 2022 Women's World Cup, India batter Yastika Bhatia said she's very pleased with her performance. "I would have liked some more runs to contribute to the team, but nevertheless, very happy with the result," she added. Yastika scored 50 runs off 80 balls.

82.title: Delhi govt to build Army training school, will be free for students
82.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Tuesday said that the 'Shaheed Bhagat Singh Armed Forces Preparatory School' will be built in the city's Jharoda Kalan area, which will be free for students. "The school will admit students to classes 9 and 11. There will be 200 seats, 100 in each class. We have already received 18,000 applications," Kejriwal said.

83.title: 10 Ukrainian hospitals destroyed since start of conflict: Ukraine
83.article_body: Ten hospitals in Ukraine have been destroyed since Russia began its invasion last month, Ukrainian Health Minister Viktor Lyashko said on Tuesday. Other hospitals could not be restocked with medicines and supplies because of fighting nearby, he added. Separately, Lyashko also said that COVID-19 testing was being carried out only in areas where there was no fighting.

84.title: Wawrinka to play ATP Challenger Tour event on return from foot injury
84.article_body: Former world number three Stan Wawrinka will return following a year-long foot injury at the ATP Challenger Tour event in Spain next week. The 36-year-old has also been awarded a wildcard to the main draw of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Monte Carlo. Wawrinka is a three-time Grand Slam champion, his last title being the US Open in 2016.

85.title: One team I'm missing a shirt from: Finch on record 9th IPL team signing
85.article_body: Asked whether he has merchandise from all eight teams represented by him in IPL so far, Aaron Finch said, "There's one team I'm missing a shirt from but I can't remember which one." Finch was signed by KKR as a replacement for England batter Alex Hales, who withdrew due to bubble fatigue. KKR is Finch's record ninth franchise in IPL.

86.title: Expert team visits PMC's 1st medical college to check preparedness
86.article_body: A team of expert doctors from the Maharashtra University of Health Sciences visited the current campus of Pune Municipal Corporation's (PMC) first medical college on Monday. The team visited the Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College to assess its preparedness, which is set to commence MBBS classes this year. The team checked college's hostel arrangements, among other facilities.

87.title: Sensodyne asked to discontinue misleading ads, fined ₹10 lakh
87.article_body: The Central Consumer Protection Authority has imposed a ₹10 lakh fine on Sensodyne while ordering it to discontinue certain misleading advertisements within seven days. Ads that claimed Sensodyne as 'Recommended by dentists worldwide' and 'World's No.1 sensitivity toothpaste' have been ordered to be stopped. Earlier, Sensodyne was asked to stop ads that showed endorsement by foreign dentists.

88.title: Hyd Police conducts drive against vehicles using MLA stickers illegally
88.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police started a special drive on Saturday against vehicles using MLA, police and press stickers illegally. The drive, which is also against vehicles using tinted glass and improper number plates, was conducted after an SUV with an MLA sticker hit street vendors and killed an infant in Jubilee Hills. Officers imposed challans against vehicles violating CMV rules, 1989.

89.title: Delhi man drugs & rapes woman after proposing marriage, booked
89.article_body: Police have booked a Delhi man for allegedly raping a 35-year-old woman after proposing marriage and threatening to circulate her private pictures on the internet. According to the woman, the accused raped her after serving her a sedative-laced drink in Mohali. Refusing to marry her, he threatened to circulate pictures of the act if she filed a case against him.

90.title: New Zealand reports 20,907 new community COVID-19 cases, 15 deaths
90.article_body: New Zealand Ministry of Health on Tuesday reported 20,907 new community cases of COVID-19. The officials added that Auckland logged the highest number of cases with 4,291 infections followed by Canterbury with 3,488 cases. The ministry also said the country reported 15 deaths on the same day taking the total number of publicly reported deaths to 199.

91.title: 2 arrested for robbing man, female friend of ₹76,000 in Pune's Pashan
91.article_body: Two people have been arrested in Pune in connection with the Pashan Hill robbery case, wherein a man and his female friend were allegedly beaten up and forced to make digital transfers worth ₹76,000. Police said the search for the third suspect is currently on. The victims were sitting on a rock on Pashan Hill when the accused approached them.

92.title: Hyd Police shares post on need of Anti-Drug Committees with helpline
92.article_body: Hyderabad Police on Monday shared a post about the need for Anti-Drug Abuse Committees. The force, while using the hashtags 'SayNoToDrugs' and 'AntiDrugCampaign' on Twitter, wrote, "For...better future for...students, every institution should have...policy to be a drug-free campus and the first step...is to set up 'Anti-Drug Abuse Committees'." It also shared a number for help and reporting cases.

93.title: Celina shares old pic with Priyanka, says 'seems we were forced to pose like dolls'
93.article_body: Actress Celina Jaitly has shared a picture from an old photoshoot with actress Priyanka Chopra on Twitter. "I have always wondered what [Priyanka] and I were thinking when we did this shoot back then lol...It seems we were either very cold or superhero action figures forced to pose like dolls," she wrote.

94.title: UN panel of nations holds talks to reduce carbon emissions
94.article_body: Nearly 200 members of UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) gathered virtually in London to discuss plans to reduce carbon emissions. As per IPCC, the third and final report stresses on ways in which key sectors such as energy, transport, industry and agriculture can cut emissions. The former two reports discussed the causes and impacts of climate crisis.

95.title: New Delhi remained world's most polluted capital in 2021: Report
95.article_body: A report by IQAir, a Swiss air quality technology company, stated that India's overall pollution levels worsened in 2021 and New Delhi remained the world's most polluted capital. As per the report, not a single country managed to meet the World Health Organization standards last year. The report surveyed pollution data from 6,475 cities.

96.title: Biker hits elderly man waiting for bus, Cyberabad police shares video
96.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Tuesday posted a video of a road accident in the city. The video shows an elderly man, who was waiting for a bus, being hit by a speeding bike. According to the police, the victim sustained severe injuries in the accident. "Don't let your speed suffer innocents. Drive Responsible. Be safe," the police captioned the video.

97.title: 'Pradeep not alone in struggling', says man to Vinod Kapri; filmmaker shares texts
97.article_body: After his video showing 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra running at night to train for Army exam, filmmaker Vinod Kapri shared texts from Facebook users who reached out to him for help in getting jobs. "Pradeep isn't the only one...There are others struggling even more," said one user. He said he'd done MA, BEd and is now working in a stone factory.

98.title: Nephew said bua is worth something: Shabana Azmi on 'Halo' casting
98.article_body: Veteran actress Shabana Azmi has revealed that her brother Baba Azmi's 15-year-old son Viraj said that bua (aunt) is really worth something after she was cast in American series 'Halo'. "My nephew...had never given me time of day before that," the actress added. Shabana will portray the head of the Office of Naval Intelligence Admiral Margaret Parangosky in the series.

99.title: Yemen's Houthis target Saudi oil site, satellite photos surface
99.article_body: Satellite photos from Planet Labs PBC, a US public Earth imaging company, on Tuesday showed Yemen's Houthi rebels targeted the Saudi Aramco oil storage tank situated in Jeddah on Sunday. According to the firm, missile attack by the Iran-backed rebel group also struck a petrochemicals complex in Yanbu and North Jeddah Bulk Plant, which stores diesel, gasoline and jet fuel.

100.title: Strongly committed to relations with Taiwan: Marshall Islands Prez
100.article_body: Marshall Islands President David Kabua has said that the country is "strongly committed" to its ties with Taiwan, adding that he's confident of their "unique alliance". "It's time for Taiwan to take its rightful place as an equal member of...family of nations," Kabua added. The Marshall Islands is one of the 14 countries that maintain formal diplomatic ties with Taiwan.

101.title: Russians fight each other for sugar in supermarket; video goes viral
101.article_body: A viral video on social media showed Russians fighting with each other for sugar at a supermarket amid the Russia-Ukraine conflict. It showed a staffer pushing a trolley full of sugar bags in the supermarket, prompting shoppers to fight each other to get hold of some. Since the end of last week, sugar prices have risen by 12.8% in Russia.

102.title: 90 lakh children to be vaccinated against polio in Africa: UNICEF
102.article_body: More than 90 lakh children will be vaccinated against polio in four African countries in the inoculation drive launched this week, according to UNICEF. The drive was launched after Malawi reported a polio outbreak last month. The vaccination drive is currently underway in Malawi and it will be expanded to neighbouring Mozambique, Tanzania and Zambia on Thursday, UNICEF said.

103.title: Putin is clearly considering using biological and chemical weapons: Biden
103.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday dismissed Russian President Vladimir Putin's accusations that Ukraine has biological and chemical weapons, adding, "That's a clear sign he's considering using both of those." Biden said Putin is setting up "false flags" and asserting that America has biological and chemical weapons in Europe. He said this accusation was also "simply not true".

104.title: Indians can visit Mansarovar via Uttarakhand by Dec 2023: Gadkari
104.article_body: Minister of Road Transport & Highways Nitin Gadkari said on Tuesday that Indians will be able to visit Kailash Mansarovar via Uttarakhand by December 2023, without going through Nepal or China. A road was being carved out from Pithoragarh to take a person straight to Mansarovar. This road would provide a smooth ride unlike the present treacherous trek, he said.

105.title: Bappi Lahiri wanted Ranveer Singh to play him in biopic: Bappa
105.article_body: Bappi Lahiri's son Bappa Lahiri has said his father wanted Ranveer Singh to play the late singer in his biopic. "This was three-four years back, we were having a couple of meetings with producers and dad loved Ranveer Singh," he stated. Bappa added that Ranveer hasn't been approached yet as the writing and pre-production work for the biopic is unfinished.

106.title: We have got a script ready: John Abraham on 'Attack' sequel
106.article_body: Actor John Abraham, speaking about his upcoming film 'Attack', has said that the script of the film's sequel is ready. "We signed on for 'Attack 2' with Jayantilal Gada (producer) even before the release of 'Attack'," he added. John further said, "When you see our film, you will realise that our film needs to take the story forward."

107.title: No evidence my fist blow killed the man: Sidhu to SC in 1988 road rage case
107.article_body: Navjot Singh Sidhu has told Supreme Court there is no conclusive evidence to show his single fist blow led to the death of a 65-year-old man in a 1988 road rage case. He said it while opposing a plea by the victim's family to punish him for a more serious offence like culpable homicide or murder, than for causing hurt.

108.title: I'll never do daily soaps again, almost quit acting: Deepika
108.article_body: Actress Deepika Singh Goyal, known for portraying Sandhya in 'Diya Aur Baati Hum', has said that she will never do a daily soap again. The actress added that the lifestyle caused health problems for her which almost made her quit acting. She further said that she is able to bear her own expenses due to social media.

109.title: Paris 2024 Olympics organisers plan to sell record 13.4 million tickets
109.article_body: Organisers of the Paris 2024 Olympics are claiming to put 13.4 million tickets available for the event, which include 3.4 million for Paralympic Games, the chief of the organising committee Tony Estanguet said. He added that the cheapest tickets for the Olympics and Paralympics will cost €24 and €15 respectively. "Ticketing programme represents one-third of our revenue," he said.

110.title: Don't know why people think I've stopped working in B'wood: Rituparna
110.article_body: Actress Rituparna Sengupta has said that she never stopped working in Bollywood. "I don't know why people think I have stopped working and call every Hindi project of mine as my 'comeback' project," she added. Rituparna stated that she might have worked more in the Bengali film industry at times, however, added the Hindi film industry has always been there.

111.title: Had sent Aamir Khan a photograph of myself with love letter: Shefali
111.article_body: When asked who was the person on whom she had a crush on during her college days, actress Shefali Shah named actor Aamir Khan. Shefali revealed she sent a photograph of herself with a love letter to the actor. "In the photograph, I was standing there (gesturing far away) but it was looking...nice because it was blurred," she added.

112.title: Congress unaffected by victory or defeat: Mallikarjun Kharge
112.article_body: Senior Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge has said that Congress is "not affected by victory or defeat" in elections. Kharge said, in context to the party's debacle in the recent five state assembly elections, that the Congress "doesn't engage in vote-bank politics and also, doesn't abandon its core ideology". He further accused BJP of being a "dictatorial party".

113.title: 45-yr-old man dies as DTC bus runs over him in Delhi; bus driver held
113.article_body: A 45-year-old man was killed after a low-floor non-AC Delhi Transport Corporation bus hit his motorcycle and ran over him as he fell off his bike, said police. The incident occurred on Delhi's Outer Ring Road flyover near Peeragarhi on Saturday. The driver tried to flee from the spot after the accident, but a police constable chased and nabbed him.

114.title: Men throw toilet cleaner on B'luru woman from her house's window; held
114.article_body: A civil contractor and his associate were detained for allegedly throwing toilet cleaner on a woman through the open window of her house in Bengaluru, a report stated. The contractor had reportedly given the woman around ₹3,00,000 to lease a single-bedroom house. However, as he felt that she was ignoring her, he allegedly harmed her. The victim sustained burn injuries.

115.title: It's amazing that I've a partner who is equally creative: Santanu on Shruti
115.article_body: Artist Santanu Hazarika said he feels blessed to share a special bond with his girlfriend, actor Shruti Haasan. He added, "It is amazing that I have a partner who is equally creative and provocative in her own domain. Every day, I come up with so many different ideas, thoughts and perspectives." "The pandemic and lockdown...made us more patient," he said.

116.title: Over 3,000 people to get offers in 'Job Mela' organised by Hyd Police
116.article_body: More than 3,000 people will get offers in the 'Job Mela' organised by the West Zone of the Hyderabad City Police on March 26. Around 30 companies, including ICICI Bank, Arena Animation and PVR Cinemas, are participating in the event, which will take place at Hyderabad's Sri Kotla Vijaya Bhaskar Reddy Stadium. Reportedly, the vacancies are open to all genders.

117.title: People are quite shameless: Vidya Balan on roles being offered to her
117.article_body: Discussing the kind of roles that are offered to her, actress Vidya Balan said, "People are quite shameless and will come...with everything. Sometimes I go, 'Brother...will you give me the hero's role'." "I am not saying that I will only play the most important role but I need something that I can dig my teeth into," added Vidya.

118.title: People recognise me because of Baahubali, it was a game-changer Prabhas
118.article_body: When asked about his game-changing project, actor Prabhas said it's 'Baahubali'. "It is definitely 'Baahubali' for my life. It was super exciting for me. Anywhere I come (people recognise me)," he added. "All this happened because of [that film]. So, everything in my life is 'Baahubali' even if I get lucky and bigger but it's all that film," he said.

119.title: So inspirational, world must know: Devgn on true stories like 'The Kashmir...'
119.article_body: Talking about movies based on true stories like film 'The Kashmir Files', Ajay Devgn said, "When you hear stories, some of them are so inspirational. Sometimes the truth is so amazing that you can't write fiction like that." "When you hear a true story, you feel that the world must know about it," added Devgn.

120.title: It was tricky as my name was last among the pacers: Unadkat on mega auction
120.article_body: Fast bowler Jaydev Unadkat said he is really excited for IPL 2022 having joined five-time champions Mumbai Indians, who have "ruled" the IPL over the years. "When [the mega auction] started, it was nervy because my name was last [among the pacers]. It was tricky," added Unadkat. Unadkat was bought by MI for ₹1.3 crore in the mega auction.

121.title: It's not right to lie knowingly: Apple's Wozniak on Theranos Founder
121.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak while discussing blood-testing startup Theranos' Founder Elizabeth Holmes said, "It's not right to deceive and lie knowingly." "If she was motivated too much by money, then she's not my type," he added. Holmes was found guilty of three counts of fraud and one count of conspiring to defraud private investors.

122.title: Saluting all Madam Sirs: Rasika on 'Delhi Crime' completing 3 years
122.article_body: Rasika Dugal shared a post as her show Delhi Crime completed 3 years. Taking to Instagram, Rasika shared the montage of the character she essayed in the show and wrote, "This one is close to my heart. I miss your sensitivity Delhi Crime team and I miss your idealism, Neeti Singh. Here's saluting all Madam Sirs!"

123.title: Cried a lot the 2nd time, couldn't see the 3rd time: Kapil Dev on watching '83'
123.article_body: Kapil Dev said the movie '83' did not impact him a lot the first time but he cried a lot while watching the second time, adding that he left the third time as he couldn't watch it. "I couldn't believe our lives have been transpired so beautifully," stated Dev. Ranveer Singh portrayed India's 1983 World Cup-winning captain in the film.

124.title: Fresh notices sent to Sonia, Rahul, Kapil Mishra in Delhi riots case
124.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday issued fresh notices to several political leaders, including Congress' Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi and BJP's Kapil Mishra, while hearing pleas in connection with Delhi riots cases and alleged hate speeches by political leaders. The court sought a response from them on the application which freshly impleaded them as a party in the case.

125.title: It was a wonderful experience: Kapil on visiting Konark Sun Temple in Odisha
125.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma is in Odisha, where he is shooting for Nandita Das' directorial. The comedian-actor recently visited the Sri Jagannatha Temple in Puri and the Konark Sun Temple, which is 35 kilometres from Puri. Taking to Instagram, he shared his picture from the Konark Sun Temple, and wrote, "It was a wonderful experience visiting #Konark #suntemple...#odisha."

126.title: 15,300 Russian soldiers killed, 509 enemy tanks destroyed: Ukraine
126.article_body: Ukraine's military on Tuesday claimed that it has killed about 15,300 Russian soldiers since the Russian invasion began on February 24. The military also claimed that it has destroyed 509 Russian tanks and over 222 aircraft, including 123 helicopters. It further estimated that its troops have destroyed 1,556 armoured personnel carriers, 252 artillery systems and 80 multiple launch rocket systems.

127.title: Whenever I scored runs, someone else scored better: Karun Nair
127.article_body: Karun Nair, who'll feature for RR in IPL 2022 after being bought for ₹1.4 crore, has said people don't see him as a T20 specialist because he has been asked to play different roles over the years. He also added, "Whenever I scored runs, someone else scored better in the same match." Karun didn't play a single game last season.

128.title: UP STF rescued birds of endangered species, two held
128.article_body: On World Sparrow Day, the Special Task Force of UP Police on Sunday rescued endangered species of birds, 206 parrots and 18 munia, in a joint operation in Lucknow, senior police officials said. Two people who were involved in the sale and purchase of these endangered species were arrested and booked under different sections of the Wild Life Conservation Act-1972.

129.title: Ajay Devgn always wanted to be a director, not an actor: Rohit Shetty
129.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty said actor Ajay Devgn "always wanted" to be a director and not an actor, adding that his technical knowledge as a director is "unparalleled". Ajay is the director, one of the producers and will star as well in the upcoming film 'Runway 34'. "Ajay...goes all out [as a producer] if he believes in the script," stated Rohit.

130.title: They play on a lot of easy pitches at home: Rashid Latif on Kohli, Smith
130.article_body: Talking about Virat Kohli and Steve Smith, ex-Pakistan captain Rashid Latif said they play on a lot of "easy" pitches at home, with Smith yet to score a century in Australia's Test series against Pakistan. Kohli last scored an international hundred in November 2019. "Once Smith starts scoring runs, fielders are placed [accordingly] and he gets bogged down," added Latif.

131.title: Infiltration across LoC declined significantly since 2018: Centre
131.article_body: The Centre informed Lok Sabha on Tuesday that infiltration across Line of Control (LoC) in Jammu and Kashmir has decreased significantly since 2018. Around 366 infiltrations were reported between 2018 and 2021, MoS for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai said. "As per inputs, significant number of suspected terrorists remain present at various launchpads in Pakistan or Pakistan occupied Kashmir," he added.

132.title: Make Mumbai mosquito-proof: BMC Commissioner to officials
132.article_body: Mumbai Municipal Commissioner Iqbal Singh Chahal on Monday directed municipal officials and other agencies to make Mumbai mosquito-proof by April 30. He asked officials to mosquito-proof water tanks, dispose waste and scrap materials, fumigate mosquito-breeding areas and share photos of the completed work with him. Mumbai reported 5,032 cases of malaria between January and December 12, 2021.

133.title: Harry Potter actress Bonnie Wright marries Andrew Lococo; pics surface
133.article_body: Bonnie Wright, best known for playing Ginny Weasley in the Harry Potter, has gotten married to boyfriend Andrew Lococo. The wedding took place at Andrew's farm, with Bonnie's friend solemnising the marriage. "Yesterday was the best day of my life thanks to my husband," Bonnie wrote on Instagram while announcing the wedding.

134.title: Glenn Maxwell, wife Vini Raman share pictures from their haldi ceremony
134.article_body: Australian cricketer Glenn Maxwell and his wife Vini Raman took to Instagram to share pictures from their haldi ceremony. "A little glimpse into our intimate Nalangu/Haldi ceremony," wrote Vini. In another post, she wrote, "What's that saying...Happy wife happy life." The couple, who got married as per Christian rituals on March 18, will marry with Tamil-Brahmin customs on March 27.

135.title: State of women's sports is very fragile: World Athletics Prez Coe
135.article_body: World Athletics President Sebastian Coe has said that the state of women's sports is "very fragile" and federations need to have the right rules for transgender female athletes. Coe's comments came days after US swimmer Lia Thomas became the first transgender NCAA champion in Division-1 history. "These are sensitive issues...societal issues — they go way...beyond sport," he said.

136.title: Dhoni no longer the same finisher that he was: Reetinder Sodhi
136.article_body: Former India cricketer Reetinder Sodhi has said that MS Dhoni is "no longer the same finisher that he was known to be a few years back". Speaking on a TV show, Sodhi advocated the point of Dhoni batting higher in the order, saying, "If he takes his time, comes in the 10th over, he can hit the lusty blows later."

137.title: Bitcoin price rises to $43,337 to highest level in three weeks
137.article_body: The price of the world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin rose as much as 5.6% to $43,337 on Tuesday, its highest since March 3. Ether, the second-largest cryptocurrency by market value, climbed as much as 5.4% to its highest since February 17. Bitcoin has added over 26% since its intra-day low of $34,324 on February 24 when Russia invaded Ukraine.

138.title: Panel recommends U-turn, cycle track at Hero Honda Chowk in Gurugram
138.article_body: The district administration-formed committee has recommended the construction of a cycle track and a U-turn at the Hero Honda Chowk (HHC) in Gurugram. The recommendations have been made to prevent driving on the road's wrong side and to make Delhi-Gurgaon Expressway more accessible, SDM (Gurugram) said. The committee had members from the district administration, police and NGOs.

139.title: ACB recovers 5kg gold, 15kg silver from businessman's house in B'luru
139.article_body: Anti Corruption Bureau on Tuesday recovered nearly 5 kg gold, 15 kg silver and 61.9 grams of diamonds from a businessman's house in Bengaluru, ANI reported. This comes after ACB conducted raids at residences of nine middlemen/agents suspected of influencing government officials in Bengaluru. They're suspected of being involved in malpractices in activities of the Bangalore Development Authority.

140.title: Andhra Pradesh Assembly Speaker suspends 4 TDP members
140.article_body: Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly Speaker Thammineni Seetharam on Tuesday suspended four Telugu Desam Party (TDP) members from all sessions of the Assembly. This comes after the TDP members chanted slogans at the podium, demanding an inquiry into a liquor brand and a judicial inquiry into the Jangareddygudem incident. Their suspension will continue till the end of the current session.

141.title: Madhuri Dixit rents new house in Mumbai for ₹12.5 lakh per month
141.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit and her husband Dr Shriram Nene have rented a new house in Mumbai. Located on the 29th floor of a high-rise building, the couple has taken the house on lease and the rent is ₹12.5 lakh per month. Located in Worli, the house has a carpet area of 5,500 square feet and a view of the city.

142.title: Most ill-timed tweet ever: Actor Adil after criticism over his tweet on 'The Kashmir...'
142.article_body: After being criticised over his 'Truth must be spoken tenderly' tweet on 'The Kashmir Files', actor Adil Hussain tweeted, "My tweet was a general comment about my idea of Art. And I stand by it." He added, "I was flummoxed by most of the reactions to tweet in question...This tweet of mine is probably the most ill-timed tweet ever."

143.title: Champions are made like this: Harbhajan on 19-yr-old seen running at night in viral clip
143.article_body: Reacting to the viral video of 19-year-old Pradeep Mehra who was seen running in the night in Noida, former Indian cricketer Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "He will be a winner." "Champions are made like this...whether on sports field or anything they do in life," he wrote. Former England cricketer Kevin Pietersen said, "This will make your...morning. What a guy!"

144.title: Ambani's Jio World Centre in Mumbai gets armed CISF cover: Report
144.article_body: The Union government has sanctioned armed security cover of over 200 CISF personnel to guard the Jio World Centre opened by Reliance Industries in Mumbai, PTI reported. The business and entertainment centre, spread across 18.5 acres in Bandra Kurla Complex, will receive counter-terrorist cover. Mukesh Ambani and Nita Ambani are protectees of the CRPF VIP security wing.

145.title: Burn more bodies per day: S Korea to crematoriums amid rising COVID deaths
145.article_body: Amid rising number of COVID-19 deaths, health officials in South Korea have ordered crematoriums to burn more bodies per day and funeral homes to add more refrigerators to store dead bodies. South Korea is witnessing a COVID-19 surge due to the Omicron variant. So far, the country has reported more than 99.3 lakh virus cases and over 13,140 coronavirus-related deaths.

146.title: Ukrainian Prez Zelenskyy to virtually address Japanese Parliament
146.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will virtually address the Japanese Parliament on Wednesday amid Russia's ongoing military offensive in Ukraine. Zelenskyy, who has also made virtual addresses in US Congress and Parliaments of Israel and Canada, is expected to speak for about 10 minutes. Notably, Japan has adopted sanctions against Russia and also sent non-lethal military aid to Ukraine.

147.title: US lawmakers raise concerns around Musk's business in China: WSJ
147.article_body: Some US lawmakers have raised concerns over Elon Musk-owned SpaceX's ties in China, questioning if Beijing could exploit the ties to gain access to classified information through its foreign suppliers, the WSJ reported. Utah's Representative Chris Stewart reportedly said, "I am a fan of Elon Musk...but anyone would be concerned if there are financial entanglements with China."

148.title: Woman arrested with 2 kg cannabis in Noida's Sector 81: Police
148.article_body: A married woman was arrested with two kgs of cannabis in Noida, police officials said on Monday. The "accused...was held near the Sector 81 metro station road close to Shiv Shakti Enclave", they added. "An FIR has been lodged against her...under the provisions of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act," they further said.

149.title: CBI to probe Gurugram's Chintels society incident: Haryana CM Khattar
149.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday announced in the state assembly that the Chintels society incident would be probed by the CBI. Two women were killed after a portion of a tower collapsed at Gurugram's Chintels Paradiso society in Sector-109. Following the incident, an FIR was registered against the builder, contractor and five other parties.

150.title: Ghaziabad civic body starts construction of 5 sports facilities
150.article_body: The Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation has started constructing sporting facilities in five different areas in its jurisdiction. "The corporation maintains several parks in the city, but people don't prefer to play sports in parks. This is why the corporation decided to develop the...facilities," an official said. Some commercial sports centres will also be developed in Ghaziabad, the official added.

151.title: What is wrong with saffronisation of education system: VP Naidu
151.article_body: Responding to allegations that the BJP government is saffronising India's education system, Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu, said, "what is wrong with saffron?". He further urged Indians at large to give up their "colonial mindset" and learn to take pride in their Indian identity. He added that "Indianisation" of the country's education system is the aim of new education policy.

152.title: Delhi airport to get 2 rainwater storage tanks of total 9 million litre capacity
152.article_body: Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport is setting up two rainwater storage tanks, Delhi International Airport Limited (DIAL), the airport's operator, said on Tuesday. "The two reservoirs, one near Terminal 1 and the other near Terminal 2, will become operational in the coming monsoon. These would help the airport store about nine million litres of rainwater," DIAL added.

153.title: Will support Pakistan in defending territorial integrity: China
153.article_body: China has said that it will support Pakistan in "defending its sovereignty, independence and territorial integrity" no matter what changes happen internationally or within the two countries. "China will stick to its friendly policy towards Pakistan, firmly support the Pakistani people in taking a development path that fits their own national conditions," said Foreign Minister Wang Yi.

154.title: We've got praise across the world: Foreign Secy on Pak PM's comments
154.article_body: Foreign Secretary Harsh Vardhan Shringla on Monday said India has received praise from across the world for several of its foreign policy initiatives. "To say that one person (praised our foreign policy) would be wrong," he said when asked about Pakistan PM Imran Khan's comment. Khan had praised India for following an independent foreign policy amid the Ukraine-Russia war.

155.title: Was told I wasn't fat enough; they wanted someone fatter: 'Bhabi...' actor Soma
155.article_body: 'Bhabi Ji Ghar Par Hai' fame Soma Rathod spoke about her struggling days in the industry and revealed that she was body-shamed. She said, "I was told I wasn't fat enough and they were looking for someone fatter." "So, I was neither slim nor fat...We do not even get clothes for our size, why don't they make clothes our size?"

156.title: Jobs & I never had to stretch truth during Apple's early days: Wozniak
156.article_body: Apple Co-founder Steve Wozniak while discussing Apple's early days said Steve Jobs and him never had to "stretch the truth" during those days. "Everything was gold and our Apple II computer was so far ahead of the competition," he said. "We were so far ahead...they (competitors) were trying to do something I had already done five years before," Wozniak added.

157.title: History textbooks in schools aren't fully based on facts: Govt official
157.article_body: History textbooks of the NCERT are criticised as they "are not based entirely on facts", Secretary of the Department of School Education and Literacy (under Education Ministry) has said. History textbooks also offer opinions and arguments, Anita Karwal (also CBSE ex-Chairperson) said, adding, "A child should be able to distinguish between all this and come to a conclusion."

158.title: We didn't get partnerships, it cost us the game vs India: B'desh captain Sultana
158.article_body: Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana has said that they bowled "wonderfully" against India in their Women's ODI World Cup match. "We put pressure on India at times...but we didn't get enough partnerships...That's what cost us the game," she stated. Chasing India's 229-run total, Bangladesh lost the match by 110 runs. They will face Australia and England in their remaining two matches.

159.title: Water supply to parts of Pune will be affected on March 24 & 25
159.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation announced on Tuesday that water supply in parts of the city will be cut off on March 24 due to urgent maintenance work. Moreover, it added that on March 25, water will be supplied at low pressure. The areas that will be affected include Dattawadi premises, Deccan premises, Ekalavya College premises, MES and HE Factory, among others.

160.title: Pune Police increase patrolling in hilly areas after robbery incident
160.article_body: Pune Police said they have intensified patrolling in hilly areas after a recent robbery was reported at the city's Pashan Hill. Police referred to an incident that occurred on Friday, wherein three people threatened a duo and compelled them to digitally transfer ₹76,000. "We [advise] people to exercise caution and avoid going [to] these areas when it's dark," police added.

161.title: Campus Activewear gets SEBI's nod for IPO launch
161.article_body: Footwear brand Campus Activewear has received market regulator SEBI's approval for an IPO launch. Promoters Hari Krishan Agarwal and Nikhil Aggarwal will cumulatively sell 1.4 crore shares of the 5.1 crore shares that will be offered for sale by promoters and investors. The money raised will go to the shareholders and the company will not receive any of the funds.

162.title: Lalu suffering from heart & kidney issues, to be shifted to AIIMS Delhi: Doctor
162.article_body: RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, who is hospitalised in Jharkhand's Ranchi, would be shifted to AIIMS Delhi as he is facing heart and kidney-related issues, a doctor said. Lalu has been sentenced to five years in prison by a special CBI court in connection with the fifth fodder scam case. He has previously been convicted in four fodder scam cases.

163.title: He's got amazing attitude, vantage point as wicketkeeper: Ashwin on Samson
163.article_body: Praising 27-year-old wicketkeeper-batter and RR skipper Sanju Samson, Ravichandran Ashwin said he has a great attitude for the game and will definitely get better in future. "He's always open for discussion, open to opinions around the game," he added. "Sanju has got the vantage point as a wicketkeeper to judge the game with all the angles," Ashwin further said.

164.title: Policeman injured in shootout with terrorists in J&K; critical
164.article_body: A policeman was injured in a shootout between terrorists and security forces near the Zoonimar area of Jammu and Kashmir on Tuesday, police said, adding that he is critical. The policeman has been shifted to a nearby hospital. The police added that a terrorist was also injured but he probably ran away from the spot.

165.title: Punjab govt makes 35,000 temporary employees of Group C and D permanent
165.article_body: Bhagwant Mann-led Punjab government on Tuesday said that it has decided to make 35,000 temporary employees of Group C and D permanent. "Today, Aam Aadmi Party Punjab government has taken another historic decision...started the process to regularise 35,000 contractual government employees," Mann tweeted. "I've directed Chief Secretary to end such contractual and outsourcing recruitments," he said.

166.title: Govt made 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free to spread hatred: Former J&K CM
166.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Tuesday said the central government wants to "further spread hatred in people's hearts" by making the movie 'The Kashmir Files' tax-free. "They (government) are saying that every policeman and soldier...should see this movie, so that they hate us to the extreme," he added. "It is a propaganda movie," Abdullah further said.

167.title: Why can't we make films like 'Avengers', 'White House Down': John
167.article_body: Actor John Abraham speaking to the media stated, "Be it 'Avengers' or 'White House Down', why can't we make such films?" The actor further said that the Indian film industry can make films which can make the world see and say 'Wow, India can make such films too'. "If Hollywood can do it, why can't Bollywood?" John added.

168.title: Yamuna will be cleaned by Dec 2023, not 2025: Satyendar Jain
168.article_body: Delhi Water Minister Satyendar Jain on Tuesday advanced the deadline for cleaning Yamuna from 2025 to December 2023. Wastewater will be tapped in next six months and all areas will be linked to the sewer network in next 15 months, Jain said. "We'll invite you to take a dip in any stretch of the river in Delhi," he added.

169.title: Pic of govt official's signature goes viral; people say 'how will banks verify?
169.article_body: The signature of an official at the Gauhati Medical College and Hospital has gone viral on social media. Several Twitter users reacted to the signature, with one of them saying, "How will banks verify? Will they count the number of quills the porcupine has?" "Ask him to sign again...will not be able to match same number of loops," said another.

170.title: Was filled with energy by Ponting's speech, felt goosebumps: Sakariya
170.article_body: Fast bowler Chetan Sakariya, who will represent DC in IPL 2022, said, "I had heard a lot about [DC head coach] Ricky Ponting...that you will feel goosebumps [while]...in the huddle and that is exactly what happened." "The moment he ended his speech, I was filled with so much energy that I thought of...knocking the stumps over by bowling," added Sakariya.

171.title: ED searches premises linked to Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla
171.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Tuesday searched premises linked to Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik in Mumbai's Kurla. ED had arrested Malik in a money-laundering case linked to gangster Dawood Ibrahim and his aides on February 23. On Monday, a special court extended Malik's judicial custody till April 4 and allowed him to be provided with a mattress, bed and chair.

172.title: 165 kg ganja worth over ₹6 lakh seized in Odisha, 2 arrested
172.article_body: The Special Task Force (STF) of Odisha Police seized 165 kg of ganja worth over ₹6 lakh and arrested two people. The accused were apprehended during a raid  in Angul district on Monday. According to police, one of the accused is an employee of a nationalised bank. Police also seized one single barrel gun from their possession.

173.title: Japan summons Russian envoy after Moscow halts peace treaty talks
173.article_body: Japan's Vice Foreign Minister Takeo Mori summoned Russia's ambassador to Japan on Tuesday, Foreign Ministry said. This comes after Moscow decided to halt peace treaty talks with Tokyo in response to sanctions imposed by Japan over the Ukraine invasion. Russia and Japan have still not formally ended World War II hostilities due to a dispute over islands north of Hokkaido.

174.title: After what happened in SA, Team India didn't want to take chances: Gavaskar
