Gao said this in Lok Sabha while participating in a debate on the demands for grants of the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways.

347.title: Traffic to be disrupted for 10 hrs on Delhi-Gurugram Expressway tomorrow
347.article_body: Traffic on the Delhi-Gurugram Expressway is likely to be disrupted for nearly 10 hours on Wednesday as the highway will be closed for traffic from 7am to 5pm, the Gurugram traffic police said. The highway will be closed due to a proposed march in support of the demand for the creation of an Ahir regiment in the Indian Army.

348.title: I went back to my playing days as captain during auction: LSG mentor Gambhir
348.article_body: LSG mentor Gautam Gambhir has revealed that he went back to playing days as captain to gauge what their captain KL Rahul would feel about the players they were investing in during the IPL mega auction. "I was trying to think like the captain...[to] understand what KL would have felt," Gambhir stated. LSG will face GT on March 28.

349.title: Pune temple decorated with 2,000 kg grapes for Sankashti Chaturthi
349.article_body: Pictures of Pune's Dagadusheth Halwai Ganpati temple decorated with 2,000 kg grapes on the occasion of Sankashti Chaturthi has surfaced online. The grapes used for the decoration were grown by Nashik's Sahyadri Farmers Producer Company, the temple's trust said. A member of the farmers' company said that the grapes will be distributed to various NGOs and hospitals as 'prasada'.

350.title: 17-year-old drowns in Pune Municipal Corporation swimming pool
350.article_body: A 17-year-old boy drowned in a swimming pool run by Pune Municipal Corporation in Wanwadi on Sunday, police said. The deceased had gone to the pool with friends, police added. The others came out of the pool due to alleged impure water but the victim could not be found. He was later found in an unconscious state, police stated.

351.title: Case registered against Mumbai firm for cheating Axis Bank of ₹42.5 crore
351.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered a loan fraud case against a private firm for allegedly cheating Axis Bank of ₹42.5 crore. Police said the firm allegedly availed cash credit facility from the bank, but failed to repay it. Forensic auditing of the firm's accounts revealed that it used the money for purposes other than what it had claimed while availing loan.

352.title: Hyderabad Police launch fitness drive for city police personnel
352.article_body: Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand on Monday launched a 'Health and Fitness' programme for the city police personnel. The drive, launched in collaboration with NGO Helping Hand Foundation, will help promote fitness among 17,500 police staff. The programme is designed on WHO-recommended protocols and will have three components- screening, counselling and fitness.

353.title: Cleartrip 'Big Travel Sale' offers discounts on flights & hotels
353.article_body: Travel booking platform, Cleartrip has come up with 'Big Travel Sale' starting 22nd March. The campaign features celebrities like Shruti Haasan, Ravi Shastri, Mithila Palkar, and Dhruv Sehgal. Travellers can avail flat 25% off* on domestic hotels, flat 12% off* on domestic flights, and up to 15% off* on international flights. The sale ends on 31st March.

354.title: DRDO scientist held in Rohini blast case was inspired by shootout: Police
354.article_body: A 47-year-old DRDO scientist Bharat Bhushan Kataria, arrested in December 2021, in Rohini blast case was "inspired" by Rohini courtroom shootout in which three gangsters were killed, Delhi Police Special Cell said. He was held for allegedly planting a bomb in a tiffin carrier in Rohini court complex. Kataria allegedly wanted to take revenge on his neighbour, the chargesheet claims.

355.title: Cardiologist sacked after deaths of 3 patients at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi hospital
355.article_body: An associate professor of cardiology, working on contractual basis at Delhi's Rajiv Gandhi Super Speciality Hospital, was sacked after three patients with heart blockage died earlier this month, following Delhi Secretariat's orders. A committee, that was set up to review matter, is investigating allegations of medical negligence. Doctors earlier claimed two patients died before stents were placed.

356.title: OneWeb to launch satellites with SpaceX after suspending ties with Russia
356.article_body: Bharti Global and the UK co-owned OneWeb has agreed to launch its satellites with Elon Musk's SpaceX after it suspended ties with Russia's Roscosmos. This comes weeks after Russia cancelled a OneWeb launch from its Baikonur Cosmodrome in Kazakhstan. The satellite firm, whose total in-orbit constellation currently stands at 428 satellites, expects its first launch with SpaceX in 2022.

357.title: BMC to install 28 floodgates at Mithi river to prevent monsoon flooding
357.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to install 28 floodgates at Mithi river to avoid flooding during monsoon season. Officials said the floodgates will prevent overflowing water from entering the residential areas and railway tracks. "We don't have adequate space to set up horizontal floodgates...we have decided to set up vertical gates that will use less space," an official said.

358.title: Man kills neighbour for assaulting his pet dog in Ghaziabad
358.article_body: A 27-year-old man was allegedly murdered for assaulting his neighbour’s pet dog in Ghaziabad's Indirapuram area. The deceased was identified as Mohammad Mustaqeem and his neighbour as Chatar Singh. "My brother assaulted Chatar Singh's pet dog when the dog attacked him...During the fight, Chatar Singh pulled out a pair of scissors and attacked my brother," Mustaqeem's brother said.

359.title: Ugandan woman, 1 other arrested with ₹8 lakh mephedrone in Goregaon
359.article_body: The Anti-Narcotics Cell on Sunday arrested two persons including a woman from Uganda and recovered the drug mephedrone worth ₹8.20 lakh from their possession in Mumbai's Goregaon. According to the police, the 28-year-old Ugandan woman, Babire Grace, came to India in 2019 on a tourist visa. Officials are now trying to trace the source of narcotic drugs and their customers.

360.title: Angry about being denied lift back home, man stabs friend in Mumbai; held
360.article_body: Mumbai Police have arrested a man, Bhavin Kolekar, for attacking and seriously injuring his 26-year-old friend who allegedly refused to drop him home. Kolekar attacked his friend with a sharp object. "The accused is a habitual drinker and a jobless man, he attacked his friend out of jealousy, as the victim is employed and earns money," police said.

361.title: Domestic LPG cylinder price hiked by ₹50 for 1st time since October
361.article_body: The price of a domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by around ₹50 in Delhi, Mumbai and other cities, the first hike since October 6, 2021. A 14.2 kg cylinder now costs ₹949.50 in Delhi and Mumbai as against ₹899.50 earlier, while in Kolkata, it costs ₹976. On Tuesday, petrol price was also hiked for the first time since November.

362.title: Rapper MC Tod Fod, who featured in 'Gully Boy', passes away aged 24
362.article_body: Rapper Dharmesh Parmar aka MC Tod Fod, who featured in Ranveer Singh-starrer 'Gully Boy', has passed away aged 24. He was associated with the multilingual group Swadesi. The cause of his death is not known yet. Ranveer took to Instagram Stories to share a picture of MC Tod Fod and shared a broken heart emoji.

363.title: Petrol, diesel prices raised by 80 paise per litre after a gap of over 4 months
363.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been increased by 80 paise per litre for the first time in over four months. The rate of petrol in the country's capital Delhi is ₹96.21 per litre today while that of diesel is ₹87.47 per litre. In Mumbai, the petrol and diesel prices have increased to ₹110.82 per litre and ₹95.00 per litre respectively.

364.title: 14-yr-old girl dies after being hit by garbage truck in Bengaluru
364.article_body: A 14-year-old girl, identified as Akshaya, died after being hit by a BBMP garbage truck on Bengaluru's airport road on Monday. The victim, a Class 9 student, was reportedly trying to cross the busy road as she avoided taking the underpass which was waterlogged due to rain. Four of her friends managed to cross the road safely, said police.

365.title: Hyderabad police arrest 2 drug peddlers, seize 1.2 kg ganja
365.article_body: Hyderabad City Police have said that they arrested two alleged drug peddlers on Monday and seized 1.2 kg ganja, two phones and an auto worth a total of ₹40,000. The accused were arrested red-handed while they were waiting to sell the ganja to customers in the Mangalhat area, police added. The accused are aged 35 and 38, police further said.

366.title: 2 killed in knife attack at Swedish school; student arrested
366.article_body: Two women in their 50s have been killed following a knife attack at a Swedish school on Monday, police said. An 18-year-old man, who is a student at the school, has been arrested on suspicion of murder. Around 50 people were reportedly at the school when the incident took place, all of whom were evacuated from the building.

367.title: CBI seizes ₹28 lakh cash in raids on Senior Intelligence Officer
367.article_body: The CBI on Monday recovered around ₹28 lakh cash and incriminating documents from the premises of a Senior Intelligence Officer after conducting searches at several locations. The searches were said to have been conducted at five locations at the premises situated in Delhi, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh. They were held in connection with a bribery case against the accused.

368.title: WB introduces new govt school uniform with 'Biswa Bangla' logo
368.article_body: The TMC-led West Bengal government has introduced a common blue-and-white uniform featuring the 'Biswa Bangla' logo in all state-run schools. According to the notification, the Department of MSME and Textiles will be supplying the new uniforms. However, the move has garnered some criticism with a lawyer filing public interest litigation in Calcutta High Court against the use of the logo.

369.title: Past 5 yrs saw disconnect between people of Punjab, govt: Governor
369.article_body: The past five years saw a serious disconnect between the people of Punjab and the government as they considered themselves "masters" and the public their "servile subjects," said Governor Banwarilal Purohit on Monday. He also highlighted Aam Aadmi Party's plan for the next five years, adding that the party has a "zero-tolerance policy towards corruption."

370.title: Signs of emerging narco-terror from across western borders: Govt
370.article_body: Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt on Monday said that the situation along the western borders remains stable, but there are signs of emerging narco-terror from across the border. He further said that the situation along the Line of Control (LoC) remains stable post the Understanding of February 2021 between Director Generals of Military Operations of India and Pakistan.

371.title: Agencies running under BJP dictatorship: Abhishek on ED probe
371.article_body: TMC MP and Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's nephew Abhishek Banerjee has claimed that investigating agencies are functioning under BJP's dictatorship. His statement came after he was questioned by Enforcement Directorate (ED) for eight hours over the coal scam in West Bengal. "Since they're failing to take on TMC democratically, they're using...central agencies to scare the opposition," Banerjee added.

372.title: MP officials destroy illegal opium poppy cultivation in Rajasthan
372.article_body: An illegal opium poppy cultivation in Rajasthan's Bundi district has been destroyed by officials of the Madhya Pradesh unit of Central Bureau of Narcotics. The team, on the basis of specific intelligence information, raided the field where opium was being grown in an area measuring around 673 square metre. They, subsequently, destroyed the plants using a rotavator after taking samples.

373.title: UP man beats wife for voting against his choice, NCW seeks action
373.article_body: A Muslim woman from UP's Bareilly was allegedly beaten by her husband and thrown out of her matrimonial house for voting against his choice of political party. The NCW took cognisance of the incident and said the woman was reportedly also threatened with divorce. NCW chairperson Rekha Sharma has written to UP DGP to take action against the accused.

374.title: Over-speeding SUV kills hawker, injures several in Chhattisgarh
374.article_body: An intoxicated man driving an over-speeding SUV in Chhattisgarh's Raipur killed a roadside hawker and hit several people. Police said the hit-and-run incident, that took place late on Sunday night, also seriously injured three men on the roads of Budhapara, Purani Basti police station limits. The man, identified as Devraj Pal, was arrested by police.

375.title: Civilian shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam
375.article_body: A civilian was shot dead by terrorists in Jammu and Kashmir's Budgam district, the police informed on Monday. The area's police force said that the victim, identified as Tajamul Mohiuddin Rather, was injured after being fired upon by militants at his house in Gotpora village. In another incident, a non-local was attacked by militants in Pulwama district and left injured.

376.title: Cabinet approves extension of National AIDS Programme till 2026
376.article_body: The Union Cabinet chaired by PM Narendra Modi has approved the continuation of the National AIDS Control Programme till March 31, 2026. The Health Ministry said on Monday that it has a budget of around ₹15,500 crore. The programme, which is currently in its fifth phase, is fully funded by the Government of India.

377.title: Hope wisdom prevails in future: Tharoor as Sonia denies permission for CPI(M) event
377.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he pulled out of a CPI(M) event after party chief Sonia Gandhi denied him permission to attend it. Stressing on the need to follow procedures in such issues, Tharoor said, "I regret that some preferred the unseemly airing of internal differences, thereby creating a needless controversy...I hope wisdom will prevail in the future."

378.title: Apple's iMessage, Music, Maps, other services down for users globally
378.article_body: Apple's several services appeared to be experiencing outages globally on Monday. As per Downdetector, users were reporting issues with Apple Music, Apple Maps, iCloud, the App Store, iMessage, and Apple TV. In India, users from Delhi, Bengaluru, and Mumbai were reporting issues with Apple's services. Apple's System Status page is currently showing that all services are operating normally.

379.title: Uttarakhand will make rapid progress under Dhami: Rajnath Singh
379.article_body: Defence Minister and senior BJP leader Rajnath Singh congratulated Pushkar Singh Dhami on being chosen as Uttarakhand Chief Minister on Monday. While talking to media outside the party's office in Dehradun, he said, "I'm confident that under his leadership Uttarakhand will make rapid progress." Dhami will be taking over the reins of the state for the second time.

380.title: S Phangnon Konyak to be Nagaland's first woman Rajya Sabha MP
380.article_body: BJP leader S Phangnon Konyak is set to become the first woman Rajya Sabha MP from Nagaland after winning the Rajya Sabha seat on Monday. "Women comprise 50% of the electorate. While Naga women have been very actively involved in politics, they haven't been forthcoming to contest the elections," she said. Konyak is the second Naga woman parliamentarian.

381.title: Indian startups are disrupting the world: NITI Aayog CEO
381.article_body: Indian startups are disrupting the world, especially in new emerging areas of health, nutrition and agriculture, according to NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant. He said women-owned businesses and enterprises are playing a very prominent role in society and will soon be the next big disruption. India at present has over 61,000 startups and 81 unicorns, he added.

382.title: Russia halts peace treaty talks with Japan over sanctions
382.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Monday said that Russia has decided to withdraw from peace treaty talks with Japan in response to sanctions imposed by the Japanese government over the conflict in Ukraine. It also accused Japan of "consciously choosing an anti-Russian course". Japan claims four Russian-controlled islands as its own in a dispute dating back to World War II.

383.title: Akhilesh alleges irregularities in vote counting during UP polls
383.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged that there were irregularities in counting of votes during the Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls. He said that the SP candidate from Varanasi South was leading till 20 rounds of counting. However, counting of votes was suddenly stopped and some time later, BJP's Neelkanth Tiwari, a minister, was declared the winner, he added.

384.title: 3 workers missing after blast at dynamite factory in Greece
384.article_body: Three workers were reported missing following an explosion at a dynamite factory in northern Greece, authorities said on Monday. "This...explosion...was detected dozens of kilometres away," the regional governor, Giorgos Kasapidis, said. "Explosives experts and rescue specialists are on the way to secure the site and make sure there are no secondary consequences from the...explosion," he added.

385.title: 10-minute gamble with worker's life: Karti on Zomato's 10-minute delivery service
385.article_body: Congress MP Karti P Chidambaram on Monday criticised Zomato's upcoming 10-minute food delivery service 'Zomato Instant' and tweeted, "This is a ten-minute-long gamble with a gig worker's life." He also tweeted, "This is absurd! It's going to put undue pressure on the delivery personnel, who are not employees & who have no benefits or security or bargaining power with Zomato."

386.title: More than 25% crowd likely to be allowed in stadiums for IPL 2022: Reports
386.article_body: IPL 2022 will reportedly have more than 25% of the capacity crowds at the venues. The tournament will be held from March 26 to May 29 across four venues in two cities of Maharashtra, Mumbai and Pune. It has also been reported that going ahead the stadiums will have more fans than the initial matches.

387.title: Abhishek being harassed by Centre: TMC as ED questions him
387.article_body: After TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee was questioned by Enforcement Directorate in a money laundering case linked to Bengal coal scam on Monday, party spokesperson Kunal Ghosh claimed Banerjee is being harassed by the union government. BJP is controlling agencies like CBI and ED, Ghosh said. He also asked why BJP's Suvendu Adhikari wasn't questioned in cases he was named in.

388.title: Don't trouble me for interviews, hard work must be silent: Pradeep to media
388.article_body: Pradeep Mehra whose video went viral has said he's being troubled by the media for interviews, adding, "It seems like I ran a few steps and I'm being praised so much, I won't be able to focus on my goal." The 19-year-old appealed to the media to not approach him, adding, "Hard work must be silent, success must be celebrated."

389.title: It cost me 8 years of mega back pain: Musk on old pic of himself sumo wrestling
389.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday took to Twitter to share an old picture of himself sumo wrestling. "Managed to throw him, but it cost me smashing my c5-c6 disc & 8 years of mega back pain! Finally fixed with c5-c6 disc fusion," Musk tweeted. Musk had earlier challenged Russian President Vladimir Putin to a "single combat" for Ukraine.

390.title: Tried to pitch it up to dismiss Aus batters: Shaheen on Day 1 of 3rd Test
390.article_body: Having reduced Australia to 8/2 after three overs on Day 1 of third Test against Pakistan, Pakistan pacer Shaheen Shah Afridi said he tried to pitch the ball up in right areas to dismiss opposition batters. He added that there are many chances of getting a wicket in morning session of a Test. Shaheen dismissed David Warner and Marnus Labuschagne.

391.title: Virat Kohli joins RCB bio-bubble ahead of IPL 2022, RCB share pics
391.article_body: Former RCB captain Virat Kohli joined the team bio-bubble ahead of IPL 2022. RCB took to social media to share pictures of Kohli, writing, "King Kohli has arrived! That's it. That's the news." RCB will face PBKS in their IPL 2022 opener on March 27 at DY Patil Stadium in Navi Mumbai. RCB will be led by Faf Du Plessis.

392.title: Who is Swami Sivananda, the 125-yr-old yoga guru awarded the Padma Shri?
392.article_body: Born in 1896, in Sylhet district (now in Bangladesh), Swami Sivananda practices yoga every day and eats food without oil and spices. For the last 50 years, he has been serving 400-600 leprosy-affected beggars by arranging food, clothes and other essentials for them in Puri. In an earlier interview, he said he owed his age to "yoga, discipline and celibacy".

393.title: US sanctions Sudan's police force over crackdown on protesters
393.article_body: US has placed sanctions on Sudan's Central Reserve Police, accusing it of using excessive force on anti-coup demonstrators who've been protesting against the country's military coup since October last year. "We condemn Sudan’s security services for killing, harassing, and intimidating [people]," US Treasury Department said in a statement. Over 80 people have reportedly died in protests since coup.

394.title: Portugal's Sao Jorge island hit by 90 small earthquakes in 24 hrs
394.article_body: Authorities in Portugal's Azores archipelago have said that the mid-Atlantic volcanic island of Sao Jorge was hit by nearly 90 small earthquakes in a little over 24 hours. The Azores Civil Protection authority has asked local mayors and fire units to "remain vigilant". The authority has requested an evaluation by experts from the region's volcanic surveillance centre.

395.title: Brazil Vice Prez Mourão won't be my running mate this time: Bolsonaro
395.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said on Monday that Vice President General Hamilton Mourão won't be his running mate in the October general elections. Bolsonaro, who will seek a second term, stated that his running mate choice will be announced formally in April. "I need a vice president that does not have the ambition of sitting in my chair," he added.

396.title: US cannot confirm Russia's use of hypersonic missiles: US official
396.article_body: A senior US defence official on Monday said the US cannot independently confirm or refute Russia's recent claim that it had used hypersonic Kinzhal missiles in Ukraine. "It could be that they're trying to send a message to the West," the official added. Russia had claimed that it had used the missiles to destroy a weapons depot in Ivano-Frankivsk region.

397.title: DC used excuse to cast non-Egyptians in 'Black Adam': Mohamed Diab
397.article_body: Mohamed Diab, the director of Marvel Studios' show 'Moon Knight', revealed he was "annoyed" with DC for creating a fictional middle eastern country as an excuse to cast non-Egyptians in 'Black Adam'. "It was...meant to be in Egypt," he added. Diab said, "It's not a full mistake since it's based on an iteration of the comics that doesn't mention Egypt."

398.title: Loyalty must be considered while naming Punjab Cong chief: Bajwa
398.article_body: Punjab Congress leader Pratap Singh Bajwa on Monday said that the appointment of the next state party chief should be based on loyalty, seniority and capability. "I leave everything to the party's high command, three factors need to be looked after," he added. Bajwa submitted his resignation as a Rajya Sabha member after being elected to the Punjab Assembly.

399.title: Indian economy better placed to deal with challenges: RBI Governor
399.article_body: Governor of the Reserve Bank of India, Shaktikanta Das on Monday said that the Indian economy is "comfortably placed to deal with any challenges with regard to financing the Current Account Deficit (CAD)". He also said that the RBI will continue to ensure liquidity to support the economy, which is facing some troubles following the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

400.title: ₹5,000 cash for those who help road accident victims in TN: CM
400.article_body: Tamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin on Monday said that people who will help provide medical care facilities to road accident victims in the state will be given a cash reward of ₹5,000. CM Stalin had earlier launched 'Innuyir Kaappon', a scheme providing free medical treatment within the first 48 hours to those injured in road accidents.
